brief.brief: The Message command panel displays a message on the last line of the specified user's screen display.

detail.detail: You can specify three different levels of messages, information, action, and error.
1. Service Manager issues an information message to provide information only. The user need not take any action.
2. Service Manager issues an action message when the user is required to take some sort of action.
3. Service Manager issues an error message when an error occurs in an application.
Enter Message Level: (number) Specify the appropriate level for the message.
Text of Message: (character) Specify the text of the message.
Send Message to User: (array of characters) Specify the user to receive the message.
- To send a message to only the local user, leave this field blank.
- To send a message to a specific user, type the name of the user.
- To send a message to multiple users, type the list names.
Message Name: (character) Specify the message source. For example, specify "database" for the database application.
Message Number: (number) Specify the message number of the source message to which this message refers.
Unless the user has an active connection to the server, the mail utility cannot display the message.
Because the server does not archive messages, they are not available for review during the next session.
The login application sets the attached resource name to the user's login name.
